newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt lets in Palestinian for medical treatment.
newsitem.headline: Egypt lets in Palestinian for medical treatment.

text.p: Egypt has let in for medical treatment one of the Palestinians stranded in a camp on the Libyan-Egyptian border, a U.N. official said on Thursday.

Manal Musbah, 30, who is between four and five months pregnant, entered Egypt on Wednesday for a medical procedure meant to prevent complications, said Panos Moumtzis, head of the Cairo office of the U.N. refugee agency UNHCR.
The rest of the more than 200 Palestinian refugees remained in the camp late on Wednesday despite a Libyan announcement that the camp was closing with immediate effect, he added.
Libyan officials failed on Tuesday to persuade the refugees to go back to Libya, which expelled them in 1995 in a political gesture to discredit Israeli-Palestinian peace agreements.

The refugees say they want to go either to the autonomous Palestinian territories or to Egypt, which will not let them in unless they can prove a third country will accept them. The Israelis will not let them into the West Bank or Gaza.
Musbah was the third refugee evacuated for medical treatment in Egypt since the camp opened in 1995. The other two refugees returned to the camp after treatment.
